unnormalised: Yeah, the NH44 is usually a good bet, but bhai, during monsoon season, parts near MP get flooded. Seriously consider the NH48 via Rajasthan if you're travelling from Delhi to Mumbai on, say, 15/07. It's like, 1400 kms but safer. Plus, those Rajasthan dhabas are worth the extra 200 kms, ya know? Just keep an eye on the news for any road closures!
normalised: Yeah, the N-H forty four is usually a good bet, but bhai, during monsoon season, parts near M-P get flooded. Seriously consider the N-H forty eight via Rajasthan if you're travelling from Delhi to Mumbai on, say, fifteenth July. It's like, one thousand four hundred kilometers but safer. Plus, those Rajasthan dhabas are worth the extra two hundred kilometers, ya know? Just keep an eye on the news for any road closures!
